To expand upon this question, I'd love to know how to tell the difference b=
etween shodai mei and nidai mei.  Mike Quigley pointed this out to me once =
on a Masanori of mine but honestly, I did not grasp the tell-tale differenc=
es.  

Ron
STL
  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Richard Turner 
  To=
: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Thursday, May 08, 2003 5:44 PM
  Su=
bject: [nihontostudy] Masanori confusion


  Greetings all, I am looking in=
to the shinto smith Masanori ( yamato no daijo fujiwara masanori ). In Fuji=
shiro's, they place the Shodai in Genna ( 1615 ) and the Nidai in Kanban ( =
1661 ) They also have a yamato no daijo masanori listed in Kan'ei ( 1624 ) =
who may or may not be the Nidia. There would seem to be quite a bit of diff=
erence in time between 1624 and 1661, I mean buy that, he would have either=
 been pretty young if he was in fact the smith working in 1623 or pretty ol=
d when listed as the Nidai. 

  I then also have volume 47 of Token Shibata=
 which has an excellent example of the Shodai's work in it and it places it=
 at Keich=F4 ( 1596 )

  Does anyone have any clarification on when the Sho=
dai and Nidai worked ?, and does Fujishiro's date them according to title. =
i.e. the Nidai received the Daijo title in 1661 so that is the date Fujishi=
ro listed him from.

  cheers all

  Rich T
